metadata.titel_preek: The Threat of Life: Permitting Its Intrusion

kernfrasen: We are on our way with God
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS A JOURNEY TOWARD NEWNESS
SIN IS OLFACTORY DECAY / SALVATION IS FRESH AIR

kernfrasen: shatters all our ways of control
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: TRADITION IS A CONTAINER / GOD IS A FORCE THAT SHATTERS

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Jesus came into their midst as a threat of newness... He caused old things to drop off and die.

cognitieve_implicaties: Loss is a prerequisite for growth
theologische_implicaties: God's grace is disruptive, not just additive
ethische_implicaties: Believers must let go of 'treasured' things to follow Christ
onbedoelde_consequenties: May imply that the Old Testament/Torah is merely 'dead' matter

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Brueggemann revitalizes the concept of 'new life' by framing it as a 'threat' and an 'intrusion' rather than a comfort.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher consistently uses the metaphor of 'Control as a Container' vs. 'God as an Unstoppable Force/Life'. Every biblical example (Sadducees, David, Jesus) is mapped onto this tension.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'Path' of the journey is defined by the 'Force' of surrendering to God's initiative.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the 'smell' of the Gospel to move beyond abstract doctrine.
sterktes.voorbeeld: They needed only sniff the air around him... to sense the threat.

risicos.beschrijving: The metaphor of 'shattering' might lead to a theology that disregards the value of institutional stability entirely.
risicos.voorbeeld: shatters all our categories by which we manage, control, and administer.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view all structure as inherently anti-God.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A courtroom/debate floor where Jesus 'out-Bibles' his opponents.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; bridges the 'then' and 'now' through shared schemas of fear.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Through the use of Davidic 'Thine/Thy' language emphasizing total divine initiative.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the 'Ordinary Time' focus on the 'New Math of Fidelity'.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'LIFE IS FORCE' and 'TRADITION IS A CONTAINER' metaphors. It successfully moves the hearer from a schema of 'Control' to one of 'Doxology'. The sensory metaphors (smell/sniff) are particularly effective at bypassing intellectual defenses.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Often a dead metaphor for 'going to heaven'.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Resurrection is a massive, radical, dangerous business.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from Jesus' 'silly Bible games' to 'massive power'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Clarify that the 'game' is the source domain of the Sadducees, while 'power' is the source domain of God.

entailment_checks.metafoor: GOD IS THE GOD OF THE LIVING
entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Does this imply God abandons the dead or those in grief?
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Explicitly link 'living' to the 'faithfulness of God' that spans across death.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To soften the 'shattering' with the idea of 'pruning' for growth.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to deconstruct dysfunctional religious schemas and replace them with a more expansive, doxological world-view.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT reveals that Brueggemann's 'shattering' language isn't just for dramatic effect; it's a cognitive tool to break the 'Control' schema.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's learning cycles, CMT focuses on the underlying spatial/physical mappings (Verticality of God, Container of Law) that make the sermon 'feel' true.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT highlights how the preacher uses 'Olfactory' source domains to trigger an instinctive, pre-rational response to the person of Jesus.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the tension between 'Static/Dead' and 'Dynamic/Living' domains.
